test.name: xUnit.AdditionFeature.AddTwoNumbers
test.output: Given I have entered 10 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddValue(10) (0.0s) And I have entered 20 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddValue(20) (0.0s) When I press add -> done: Steps.WhenIPressAdd() (0.0s) Then the result should be 30 on the screen -> done: Steps.ThenTheResultShouldBePass(30) (0.0s)

test.name: xUnit.AdditionFeature.AddingSeveralNumbers
test.output: Given I have entered 20 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddAnotherVal(20) (0.0s) And I have entered 30 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddAnotherVal(30) (0.0s) When I press add -> done: Steps.WhenIPressAdd() (0.0s) Then the result should be 50 on the screen -> done: Steps.ThenTheResultShouldBePass(50) (0.0s)

test.name: xUnit.AdditionFeature.AddingSeveralNumbers
test.output: Given I have entered 20 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddAnotherVal(20) (0.0s) And I have entered 30 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddAnotherVal(30) (0.0s) When I press add -> done: Steps.WhenIPressAdd() (0.0s) Then the result should be 50 on the screen -> done: Steps.ThenTheResultShouldBePass(50) (0.0s)

test.name: xUnit.AdditionFeature.FailToAddTwoNumbers
test.output: Given I have entered 20 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddAnotherVal(20) (0.0s) And I have entered -20 into the calculator -> done: Steps.AddAnotherVal(-20) (0.0s) When I press add -> done: Steps.WhenIPressAdd() (0.0s) Then the result should be -0 on the screen -> error: This is a fake failure message

failure.message: System.InvalidOperationException : This is a fake failure message
